title: How to make a living off of poetry - Quora

response.answer_text: One of my poetry professors, Glover Davis, said all poets are nuts. He had two reasons. I’ll paraphrase the first reason, which deals directly with your question: (1) REASON #1: A person must be nuts to devote themselves to an art where the only way you can make a living is to become a university professor. (2) REASON #2: Glover also told his class (and I quote): “All poets are crazy. “they have to be to devote themselves to a craft that pays so little.” In his happier moments, however, Glover would confess that it was the mystery and magic — the sheer power — of poetry that had drawn him to it. “If Philip Levine hadn’t been a poet, he would have been dictator of the world,” Glover said. “He knew the power of rhythm to move us. He could have been the greatest demagogue ever.” So — become a professor, or a demagogue, and rule the world.
It'll never happen. “All great art is made from suffering.” If you're writing poetry to make a living then you'll fuckin starve to death. You don't write poetry to make a killing… I mean living.
